subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to identify a JavaCore failure ?
msgSnippet: Hi Shinobu, 1) I guess your answer is there is no way to exclude any testcase from a Testsuite. I also want all my testcases to be pass. But due to some
messageBody:
Hi Shinobu,

1) I guess your answer is there is no way to exclude
any testcase from a Testsuite. I also want all my
testcases to be pass. But due to some reasons I want
to run only some of the testcases from a testsuites.

How I can do that ?

2) JavaCore is an enhanced debug facility for the Java
platform. It enables "core" dumping when an un-handled
Exception is thrown.Is there any way to handle this as
fail in JUnit ?


Thanks & Regards,

Joby

--- Shinobu Kawai <shinobu@...> wrote:

>
> Hi Joby,
>
> > 1) Where my testcase is creating a JavaCore but
> the
> > testcase is passing. Is there a way I can handle
> that
> > situation ?. I want to make that testcase fail.
> I don't know what a "JavaCore" is, but is the test
> handling "JavaCore"
> as you expected it to be handled? If so, I would
> say "JavaCore" is fine,
> and leave it alone. And of course, if you want to
> make a test fail no
> matter what, use fail().
>
>
http://www.junit.org/junit/javadoc/3.8.1/junit/framework/Assert.html#fail(java.lang.String)
>
> > 2)Is there any way I can exclude some testcase
> from
> > a testsuite ?
> Don't add them. But I prefer all my tests passing.
> ;)
>
> Best regards,
> -- Shinobu Kawai
>
> --
> Shinobu Kawai <shinobu@...,
> shinobu@...>
>
>
>
>
